snippet: Authorities have rounded up 169 Chinese citizens since June 1 and detained them for deportation, in the latest sign of tensions between the two countries.
abstract: Authorities in Ghana conduct sweeping arrests of Chinese citizens in nation’s gold-mining regions, latest sign of tensions between sub-Saharan African nation and global power that has become continent’s largest trading partner; small-scale mining activities of Chinese who have flooded into Ghana’s gold-producing regions have stirred resentment in West African nation.

byline.original: By ADAM NOSSITER and BREE FENG
byline.contributor: Chris Stein and Yiting Sun contributed reporting from Accra, Ghana.

lead_paragraph: Authorities have rounded up 169 Chinese citizens since June 1 and detained them for deportation, in the latest sign of tensions between the two countries.
